ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] RE: OT - Equipment question
ygData.msgSnippet: Also, my SB X-Gamer automatically installed DOS support.  If you don t play any DOS games, get into your hardware and disable it.  I did, and it solved
ygData.messageBody:
Also, my SB X-Gamer automatically installed DOS support. If you don't play
any DOS games, get into your hardware and disable it. I did, and it solved
problems for me.


-----Original Message-----
From: Henrik Holm [mailto:HEH@...]
Sent: Thursday, June 14, 2001 2:33 AM
To: 'eqbards@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] RE: OT - Equipment question


I would for sure check your interrupt settings.
Boy that problem took me some time to get rid of!
I had too many cards in my machine so:
a) Either some cards had to share interrupt
b) Or I had to remove a card.
I choose b) and removed an old ISA printer port (Dident use it anyways). I
also had to move my SB-Live from the PCI slot next to the AGP. So that slot
is now unused. Ill never take that slot into use since I learned that it
shares interrupt with the AGP!!!
Well hope you get it fixed..

Musiker.
P.S. I still use 98SE for my game machine and Linux on my server - I do not
have any plans to switch either..
> -----Original Message-----
> From: John Grady [mailto:john_grady@...]
> Sent: 14. juni 2001 08:19
> To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] RE: OT - Equipment question
>
>
> I play on two W2K systems, my home PC (Server) and my work
> notebook (Pro).
> I have one nagging EQ problem that recently surfaced with the SB Live!
> card. I've reloaded it so many times I think it might be an interupt
> problem. I also have seen a strange "out of virtual
> memory...automatically
> increasing resources..." message every time I play. These
> only occur on
> the SB system and only With EQ.
>
> Anyway, the systems are rock solid and now work great with my iDSL
> connection (was too far for ADSL). I just have to shut down
> EQ with Task
> Mgr or reboot :(.
>
> Tzeetch on Xegony
>
> --- Brett Keown <brettke@...> wrote:
>
> I run W2K and it is great :) not only do I have great
> performance from<BR>
> the game, but I have a great platform to work from when not gaming
> that<BR>
> is solid as a rock.  (Note:  I am a
> "little" biased)
>
> I too had lots of problems with Windows ME as an upgrade to an<BR>
> older box. (that box I updated to W2K Server and it runs great) I
> received ME on a new box and have never had a single problem with it.
> Kendawen Sournotes
> 34 Bard - E'ci
